alert.note: Alert for Orleans (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 2:47AM EST until December 19 at 9:17AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Vermont... Missisquoi River Near North Troy affecting Orleans County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS MORNING... * WHAT...No flooding is currently forecast. * WHERE...Missisquoi River near North Troy. * WHEN...Until late this morning. * IMPACTS...Portions of Route 100 in Troy will remain flooded, as well as low-lying farmlands along the Missisquoi River from Lowell to North Troy. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 AM EST Tuesday the stage was unknown. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 3.4 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.9 feet on 03/30/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this morning at 930 AM EST.
